title: Automatically detect & classify GitHub API errors with GPT-4o to Airtable, Notion & Slack
description:
Automatically detect, classify, and document GitHub API errors using AI.
This workflow connects GitHub, OpenAI (GPT-4o), Airtable, Notion, and Slack to build a real-time, searchable API error knowledge base ‚Äî helping engineering and support teams respond faster, stay aligned, and maintain clean documentation. ‚öôÔ∏èüìòüí¨

## üöÄ What This Template Does
1Ô∏è‚É£ Triggers on new or updated GitHub issues (API-related). ü™ù
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Extracts key fields (title, body, repo, and link). üìÑ
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Classifies issues using OpenAI GPT-4o, identifying error type, category, root cause, and severity. ü§ñ
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Validates & parses AI output into structured JSON format. ‚úÖ
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Creates or updates organized FAQ-style entries in Airtable for quick lookup. üóÇÔ∏è
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Logs detailed entries into Notion, maintaining an ongoing issue knowledge base. üìò
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Notifies the right Slack team channel (DevOps, Backend, API, Support) with concise summaries. üí¨
 8Ô∏è‚É£ Tracks & prevents duplicates, keeping your error catalog clean and auditable. üîÑ

## üí° Key Benefits
‚úÖ Converts unstructured GitHub issues into AI-analyzed documentation
 ‚úÖ Centralizes API error intelligence across teams
 ‚úÖ Reduces time-to-resolution for recurring issues
 ‚úÖ Maintains synchronized records in Airtable & Notion
 ‚úÖ Keeps DevOps and Support instantly informed through Slack alerts
 ‚úÖ Fully automated, scalable, and low-cost using GPT-4o

## ‚öôÔ∏è Features
- Real-time GitHub trigger for API or backend issues
- GPT-4o-based AI classification (error type, cause, severity, confidence)
- Smart duplicate prevention logic
- Bi-directional sync to Airtable + Notion
- Slack alerts with contextual AI insights
- Modular design ‚Äî easy to extend with Jira, Teams, or email integrations

## üß∞ Requirements
- GitHub OAuth2 credentials
- OpenAI API key (GPT-4o recommended)
- Airtable Base & Table IDs (with fields like Error Code, Category, Severity, Root Cause)
- Notion integration with database access
- Slack Bot token with chat:write scope

## üë• Target Audience
- Engineering & DevOps teams managing APIs
- Customer support & SRE teams maintaining FAQs
- Product managers tracking recurring API issues
- SaaS orgs automating documentation & error visibility

## ü™ú Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
1Ô∏è‚É£ Connect your GitHub account and enable the ‚Äúissues‚Äù webhook event.
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Add OpenAI credentials (GPT-4o model for classification).
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Create an Airtable base with fields: Error Code, Category, Root Cause, Severity, Confidence.
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Configure your Notion database with matching schema and access.
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Set up Slack credentials and choose your alert channels.
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Test with a sample GitHub issue to validate AI classification.
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Enable the workflow ‚Äî enjoy continuous AI-powered issue documentation!
